content: As an AI language model, I don't have personal opinions or preferences, but I can provide factual information on the topic. Regarding Breaking Bad, it's true that Walter White's character development was a central part of the show and what made it so compelling for many viewers. His transformation from a regular high school chemistry teacher to a ruthless drug lord was the driving force behind the show's plot and kept viewers engaged throughout the series. However, as mentioned earlier, the supporting characters also played critical roles in Walter's development, as they forced him to confront his actions and challenged his morals. It was the ensemble cast that made Breaking Bad such a successful show.
